section.name: name
section.description: hptt - an HCLI Push To Talk (PTT) channel management service

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt <command>

section.name: description
section.description: The "hptt" CLI allows you to manage radio Push To Talk (PTT) half-duplex channels. The service can act as an anchor for joining disjointed radio networks through a radio gateway by allowing them to communicate through intermediary PTT channels used to facilitate audio input/output streams.

section.name: examples
section.description: N/A

command.name: channel
command.description: The "channel" command allows you to work with logical PTT channels.

section.name: name
section.description: channel - work with logical PTT channels.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt channel <command>

section.name: description
section.description: The "channel" command allows you to work with logical PTT channels.

command.name: create
command.description: Allows you to create a new logical hal-duplex PTT channel of managing radio network audio input/output streams.

command.name: mv
command.description: Allows you to rename a logical PTT channel.

command.name: rm
command.description: Allows you to remove a logical PTT channel.

command.name: ls
command.description: Allows you to list all logical channel names.

command.name: ptt
command.description: Allows you to check the PTT status of a logical channel.

command.name: stream
command.description: Allows you to stream to and from a named PTT channel.

section.name: name
section.description: create - create a new logical PTT channel.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt channel create 'channelname'

section.name: description
section.description: The "create" command allows you to create a new, uniquely named, logical PTT channel.

section.name: name
section.description: mv - rename a logical channel.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt channel mv 'oldname' 'newname'

section.name: description
section.description: The "mv" command renames an existing logical PTT channel.

section.name: name
section.description: rm - remove a logical channel.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt channel rm 'channelname'

section.name: description
section.description: The "rm" command removes an existing logical PTT channel.

section.name: name
section.description: ls - list logical channel names.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt channel ls

section.name: description
section.description: The "ls" command allows you to list all the named logical PTT channels.

section.name: name
section.description: ptt - queries the PTT status of a logical channel.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt channel ptt 'channelname'

section.name: description
section.description: The "ptt" command queries the status of a logical PTT channel to help establish if a stream can be sent or received.

section.name: name
section.description: hptt channel stream - stream to and from a named half-duplex PTT channel

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hptt channel stream -l | -r 'channel name'

section.name: description
section.description: The "stream" command allows you to stream to or stream from the remote service against channels you have permissions to stream to and from.

section.name: examples
section.description: cat test.wav | pv -s 3846487146 | hptt channel stream -l 'default'\n\nhptt channel stream -r 'default' | pv -s 41115648 > /dev/audio

option.name: -l
option.description: Allows you to stream from a local input stream (e.g. STDIN), to a named channel.

option.name: -r
option.description: Allows you to stream from a named channel, to a local output stream (e.g. STDOUT).
